description: standing man in profile holding staff, wearing a headdress and long robe, standing towards bottom of composition; ni background, a boy carries a plum branch over PR shoulder; robed man standing on flat rock; trees with gnarly branches at L edge;  bushes LR edges; tall light peaks in distance; upper third of composition is blank.
life_date: Japanese, active late 15th century - early 16th century
text: The subject of this painting is the poet Lin Hejing of China’s Northern Song period (960–1127), staring into the distance as a young attendant draws up behind him bearing the branch of a plum tree. Lin Hejing was renowned for his love of the plum tree, which as one of the “Three Friends of Winter” represents the literati virtue of moral purity.
title: Lin Hejing Searching for Plum Blossoms
